definition: hidden beneath the surface/buried and concealed
to conceal/to hide away/to harbor/to store/to collect

sentences.english: More than just black bass lurk in these lakes. Also, there is a lake in which BARRAMUNDI inhabits .
sentences.chinese: 在湖裏不僅潛藏著黑巴斯魚，還有澳洲肺魚哦。

sentences.english: There are admirable potentialities in every human being.
sentences.chinese: 每個人都潛藏着令人敬仰的潛力。

sentences.english: But most of this energy is at high altitude.
sentences.chinese: 然而，大部分風能潛藏在高海拔區域。

sentences.english: A silent killer lurks beneath the surface of this West African lake.
sentences.chinese: 在這個西非洲湖泊的表面下潛藏着一個無聲的殺手。

sentences.english: Paint is spattered on eyeglasses. Mud lurks under fingernails.
sentences.chinese: 眼鏡被顏料塗上顏色，泥土潛藏在指甲縫間。

sentences.english: The discrimination inherent in that second-class status is harmful to gay men and lesbians.
sentences.chinese: 潛藏於次等地位中的歧視無疑對同性戀者極爲不利。

sentences.english: Pride weselves lurk under a theasystbare not cloak.
sentences.chinese: 驕傲估計會潛藏在穿舊的斗篷下。

sentences.english: Pride may lurk under a threadbare cloak.
sentences.chinese: 驕傲可能會潛藏在穿舊的斗篷下。

sentences.english: Yet this immunological sword of Damocles can be easily demonstrated.
sentences.chinese: 不過，這種潛藏的免疫危機是極容易證明的。

sentences.english: Your individuality was always latent within your soul.
sentences.chinese: 你的個體性始終潛藏在你的心靈裏。

sentences.english: Graph is lurking somewhere in there, it is.
sentences.chinese: 這張圖潛藏在這兒，是的。

sentences.english: Search methods, which are likely to harm secreted stowaways shall not be used.
sentences.chinese: 不得使用可能會對潛藏的偷渡者造成傷害的搜查辦法。

sentences.english: But there is a gender imbalance lurking in these numbers.
sentences.chinese: 但這些數字中潛藏着性別失衡。

sentences.english: Of black sea surface base, seem to conceal an innumerable to bite the person's deep sea huge monster.
sentences.chinese: 的黑色海面下，似乎潛藏着無數噬人的深海巨獸。

sentences.english: I don't know what lurks in his mind.
sentences.chinese: 我不知道他心裏潛藏着什麼。

sentences.english: Or worse, were there dangers lurking?
sentences.chinese: 或者更糟，裏面潛藏着危險？

definition: to hide/to conceal/to mask/to shelter/to harbor (i.e. keep sth hidden)/to hide oneself/to lie low/to nestle/hidden/implicit/private/covert/recessed (lighting)
to release/to set free/to liberate (a prisoner)/to discharge
regarding/as far as sth is concerned/with regards to
to peel/to strip/to peel off/to come off (of tissue, skin, covering etc)
to hold in store/to contain (untapped reserves etc)
